hook.text: What if free will and determinism are both true? Compatibilists say they coexist.

buildup.text: They redefine freedom: you're free if you act on your own desires, even if those desires have causes.

discovery.text: Hume and Daniel Dennett are famous compatibilists. Most working philosophers agree.

twist.text: Critics call it a cheat. Redefining 'free' doesn't answer whether you could have chosen differently.

climax.text: Compatibilism lets us keep moral responsibility in a deterministic world. That's its appeal.

punchline.text: Freedom isn't about physics. It's about you.

quiz.question: What do compatibilists believe?
options: Free will and determinism can coexist
